docs.snippet: The announcement came a day after Snap reported disappointing results for its third quarter, spurring analysts and investors to question whether the company was in trouble.

headline.print_headline: Tencent Raises Its Stake in Snap, Giving It a Needed Boost
headline.main: Tencent of China Raises Its Stake in Struggling Snap

docs.snippet: Hands-only videos have taken over social media, turning the disembodied hand into a symbol of artisanal craftsmanship and entrepreneurial zeal.

headline.print_headline: There’s an Allure  To Hands Online
headline.main: The Hand Has Its Social Media Moment

docs.snippet: Served still warm from the oven, pancetta and sage gougères are an indulgent and elegant hors d’oeuvres.

headline.main: Want to Pamper Your Holiday Guests? Make Gougères

docs.snippet: Repeal the rule that prevents companies from owning both a TV or radio station and a newspaper in the same market.

headline.main: Ajit Pai: Media Ownership Rules Must Adjust to the Digital Era

docs.snippet: Henda Ayari created a storm when she denounced radical Islam. Now, inspired by the #MeToo campaign, she has accused an Oxford professor of rape.

headline.print_headline: Taking On Radical Islam, and Adding Her Name to #MeToo
headline.main: ‘I Could Not Forget What Happened to Me That Night With Him’

docs.snippet: With the country so divided on so many issues, companies are increasingly finding themselves in the middle of controversies. They’re realizing it may be the new normal.

headline.print_headline: When Pizza Is Partisan, A Struggle To Adjust
headline.main: Pizza Is Partisan, and Advertisers Are Still Adjusting

docs.snippet: Vilifying whiteness and maleness isn’t just illiberal. It’s bad politics.

docs.snippet: The latest financial results for the messaging and media company Snap included higher costs and a net loss more than triple that of a year ago.
